org.gvsig.quickInfo
Class FormatDecimalNumber

java.lang.Object
  org.gvsig.quickInfo.FormatDecimalNumber

public class FormatDecimalNumber
extends java.lang.Object

Class that has a method to format decimal numbers with the criterions to display them as calculated fields in the QuickInfoListener tool.

Author:
Pablo Piqueras Bartolomé (pablo.piqueras@iver.es)

Constructor Summary
FormatDecimalNumber()
           
 
Method Summary
static java.lang.String formatDecimal(double number)
          Formats a decimal number according some criterions: If number has more than 10 digits: uses scientific notation. If number has more than 5 0's before the first non-zero after the comma: uses scientific notation. Otherwise uses normal notation. Uses 6 decimal digits as much.
static java.lang.String formatDecimal(double number, java.lang.String base, boolean superIndex)

Constructor Detail

FormatDecimalNumber

public FormatDecimalNumber()
Method Detail

formatDecimal

public static java.lang.String formatDecimal(double number)

Formats a decimal number according some criterions:

  • If number has more than 10 digits: uses scientific notation.
  • If number has more than 5 0's before the first non-zero after the comma: uses scientific notation.
  • Otherwise uses normal notation.
  • Uses 6 decimal digits as much.

Parameters:
number - the decimal number to be formatted
Returns:
the decimal number formatted

formatDecimal

public static java.lang.String formatDecimal(double number,
                                             java.lang.String base,
                                             boolean superIndex)
